# 6.5 Settings of the internal PROFINET IO interface

# Settings on the "Media redundancy" tab

The CPU 410 supports the Media Redundancy Protocol (MRP). The following settings must be used for installation of the CPU in a ring topology.

1. Select the MRP domain and configure the role of the CPU ("Manager", "Manager (Auto)" or "Client").
2. Select the "Diagnostic interrupts" check box.

Note
If the "Diagnostic interrupt" check box is not selected for the MRP Manager and an interruption of the MRP ring occurs, no message will be generated in the operator station.

# Settings on the "Time-of-Day Synchronization" tab

You can find information on the configuration of time synchronization in the following manuals:

- "CPU 410 Process Automation"
- "SIMATIC Process Control System PCS 7 High-Precision Time Stamping with Use of ET 200SP HA"

Q: What is the significance of selecting the 'Diagnostic interrupts' check box for MRP in the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: It ensures that interruptions in the MRP ring generate messages in the operator station.

A4: The document highlights its role in facilitating MRP ring failure notifications.
A5: It's necessary for the system to notify operators of any MRP ring interruptions.
